I did a late night to-go order at this place since they have a kiosk on the first floor just for takeout, the wait was about 15 mins for an order of their signature soup dumplings, pan fried buns, and chicken soup. The soup dumplings are good, definitely a viable option if you're in the area. Pan fried buns were also good, but best eaten on the spot since the fried bottoms will soften up over time. I can't say I was blown away by their offerings but I did appreciate the accessibility (parking may be difficult though since this is at the corner of a generally busy intersection) and how they also open late
Awesome Chinese Cuisine
One of my favorites, can't go wrong with this place!
Super authentic, delicious food. Gotta try the soup dumplings.
YanniæœåŠ¡éå¸¸å¥½ï¼Œçƒ­æƒ…å‘¨åˆ°

Stopped here during a trip to NY 2 weeks agoâ€¦and Iâ€™m STILL thinking about the pork soup dumplings in Flushing. Fresh pork, fragrant broth, and dough at the right consistencyâ€¦not too thick or chewy. Clearly fresh made. Recommend!
Quick service, great food! I came on a random Friday afternoon (non-holiday weekend) and there were plenty of seats. Servers were pretty attentive. Would come again.

The hotel told us this was the BEST dumpling restaurant in Flushing and they were absolutely correct. It was worth the thirty minutes of waiting to have lunch here. They truly deserve there Michelin recommendations hanging on the wall. The dumplings seem to float on air and the mushroom appetizer was even better.  Come to this restaurant instead of going on a trip to China and you will not be disappointed!!
Authentic and delicious!

The dumplings are delicious, the egg rolls are super fresh and crispy. The noodles are incredibly flavorful, and they're incredibly large. My recommendation is to order the sharing plates because they're really quite generous.

I've been here quite a few times.
Everything here is delicious and the service is perfect. ğŸ’¯
Quick service. Love the food here. 2nd visit. Will be back for more!
The soup dumplings were awesome. The â€œfour happiness sponge tofu â€œ was excellent as also the Qing Tuan. Great veg options too!

Absolutely phenomenal! Nan Xiang Xiao Long Bao never disappoints â€” the soup dumplings are perfection: delicate skin, rich broth, and flavorful filling that tastes authentic and fresh every time. The restaurant is clean, well-run, and always buzzing with energy, yet service stays quick and friendly.

The menu has so many great options beyond dumplings too â€” the scallion pancakes, noodles, and crab soup buns are all must-tries. You can tell they use quality ingredients and real craftsmanship in every dish.

If youâ€™re in Flushing and want true Shanghai-style dumplings, this is the place. Worth every minute of the wait!
Great place. Very clean and not a long wait. The soup dumplings and the pork buns we great. we always have a great time here
good taste.
Great flavor and the staff were great.
been going here for years, however it used to be better,

This is the best place for soup dumplings and braised beef noodle. Everything about the beef noodle was perfect, from the mildly spicy soup to the very tender beef. The soup dumplings are packed with soup, but make sure to not burn your tongue!

My friendâ€™s mom loves this place! Clean, comfortable, and friendly service. The rice ball tasted just like back home, and the pickled fish noodle soup was a big hit,the fish was silky and the noodles bouncy. The soup dumplings were tasty though a bit thick, but the sticky rice shumai was soft and chewy, so good! The celery and tofu dish would be even better if the tofu were cut smaller.
Amazingly delicious

This is one of the well-known dumpling chain restaurants in New York City, and we visited the Flushing location. There was no line when we arrived, so we were seated right away. However, the place was almost packed. It was late in the afternoon â€” not quite lunch or dinner â€” but we were craving dumplings and decided to give it a try.

They served complimentary hot tea, which was perfect on a chilly day. It tasted wonderful, and the staff happily refilled it throughout our meal. We ordered two types of dumplings: one green-tinted variety (likely pork with leek or herbs) and a set of chicken soup dumplings. The pork dumplings were outstanding â€” flavorful and aromatic â€” while the chicken ones were milder in taste.

The service was attentive; they brought out the dumplings in batches so each set stayed piping hot. The soup dumplings in particular were excellent â€” steamy, juicy, and comforting. They also had chili oil on the table, which added a perfect kick.

Overall, this place is a great spot for dumpling lovers â€” flavorful food, warm service, and a cozy vibe. Highly recommended if youâ€™re in the Flushing area.
A lot small local food from china. Reason prices and choice
Good Soup Dumplings (Excellent filling and broth, skin is thicker for my liking). I would suggest coming for only soup dumplings, all the other dishes I order were just OK.
cucumber salad ğŸ˜‰

Solid xiao long bao - however, by far not the best i had even in US. The dough is a bit too thick and the size is a bit too big. The flavor is good though. Canâ€™t recommend the truffle one - truffle and XLB just doesnâ€™t match.
Their pan fried baos are alright. Nothing i want come back for.
5 stars for late night opening hours though!
Good soup dumplings! I really enjoyed the drinks as well. They messed up on one order but we corrected it.
quite thick skin
They gave me the wrong soup, realized right away and tried to have them switch it. Told me Iâ€™d have to pay for both. Terrible service
Iâ€™m so excited this place opened again . The best dumplings
è®š
Delicious!!!! The soup dumpling is so juicy. You will have to try the different flavor soup dumpling. My go to place to eat.

Delicious Dumplings and noodles with quick service. Menu is extensive and omni. Since I have a vegetarian diet, my family ordered all vegetarian dishes . High recommend the stir fried rice cakes,  spongey tofu with mushroom and bamboo shoots, noodle soup, and of course, soup dumplings, and steamed dumpling.  If you like durian, the durian puff is aromatic as a dessert.

An iconic dumpling restaurant that is known for their soup dumplings! Not only can you order traditional pork soup dumplings, but also truffle & pork soup dumplings, chicken soup dumplings, abalone & pork soup dumplings, three treasures soup dumplings, and many more! Just note that it may get busy at times and you will need to join a waitlist.

In addition to their steamed soup dumplings, they offer appetizers, noodle soups, and stir-fried noodles & rice cakes. Several of their signature dishes that I also recommend are Beef Tripe in Spicy Sauce, Four Happiness Sponge Tofu, and Shanghai Stir-Fried Udon. If you want more beef and bok choy, then go for the Beef Stir-Fried Udon instead of the Shanghai Stir-Fried Udon. Other than that, enjoy!

Stopped in after seeing it in various mentions on social media. Byron was on his game and made sure we were well taken care of from beginning to end. Solid recommendation on sharing a soup bowl. Yes, they are that large! All of the dumplings we had were amazing!!! 10/10 would dine again.

Iâ€™ve come to this restaurant multiple times. Iâ€™ve ordered many different dumpling and noodle options and have never been disappointed. Restaurant is clean and has a large waiting area on the main level, dining room is up a level. The wait time can sometimes be long, but that is to be expected during the lunch and dinner rushes.
The food was delicious and UU was amazing!
Great food at a great price with great service. Not much more you could ask for

I would eat here once per week if it was in my neighborhood. Prices and value and service are all exceptional, as is the food.

The space is quite inviting and has a warm comfortable and clean feel.  The most bizarre yet hilarious thing is the background music was on a ~30 second loop, but it was very peaceful and quiet so didnâ€™t much matter.

The service was so friendly and prompt despite the place being slammed on a Saturday afternoon. The staff were running about and quickly tending to everyone at such a pace that I myself could not sustain. Despite this they were extremely friendly and helpful. They not only brought us the to-go containers, but expertly packed them up, which can be tricky with some soups.

The foodâ€¦

Wonton soup: incredible! The broth was light and refreshing, very authentic. The wontons were so tender and savory. The best part? It was like $9 or something. It could have been a full meal.

Soup Dumplings: incredible! We had 2 orders. The pork and crab meat, and the mixed. They are again savory and tender, but satisfyingly subtle and packed with a yummy broth.

We also had the woodear mushrooms and chicken soup, which were equally incredible! We couldnâ€™t even finish these because the portion sizes of the wonton soup and dumplings were so large.

I dream of this.

Favorite place to visit to soup dumplings. All the food there is delicious and very affordable. We always have the soup dumplings because they are the best. Other meals such as the wood ear mushroom salad, the spicy pig ears or the scallion pancakes are also a must try. Try to make e reservation upfront to avoid waiting.

There's nothing better than a great soup dumpling! The question is which one was better pork or chicken? I think the pork narrowly won but it was a close race! This place is no joke! Service was on point. Our server showed us how to properly eat and we enjoyed ourselves. 10 out of 10 would recommend.

We were in luck and got seating with a party of 6 right away.

The restaurant got busy quick and there was a wait list.

The reviews left by others didn't lie. Great food and service. Everything we ordered tasted amazing. Service was attentive and welcoming.

Restaurant tables were a little cramped but the food made up for it.

The dim sum, seafood noodle soup, and garlic cucumber salad are all incredibly tastyâ€”fresh, flavorful, and always satisfying. The service is fast without feeling rushed, and the staff are attentive and polite every time. Iâ€™ve never had a single negative interaction here, which makes dining here all the more enjoyable. I truly appreciate this spot and canâ€™t wait to come back, especially when the weather cools down!

lone line but highly turnover so not much wait time then we realized why? When we were still ordering our dishes and one of our friends changed her mind wanted something else but the waitress said sorry no can't change, I already sent in the dish and kitchen is making it now.... but we are still ordering!!! I guess they tried to save time but this is going to be problem for some customers if changes are not allowed? Food is fine but the best dish is the pan fried noodle with seafood on top! Soup Dumpling is just OK, too bad we had people never have soup dumplings before to try, I guess that's their first and last time.
Xiao long bao is flavorful. Their noodles dishes is delicious and  big serving. Quick service. Friendly staff. Just Be aware sometimes thereâ€™s a long wait time.

Am currently enjoying an order of pork and vegetable wontons in spicy peanut sauce!!! These little treasures are so delicious, weâ€™ve ordered a 2nd bowl. And the dumplings? Omg, tender, flavorful, with a delicate hint of spice. Wood ear mushrooms were firm textured, not mushy or gooey. This meal was truly one of the best ever.

We visited there for two consecutive days! I would be happy to return again soon. All the soup dumplings were excellent, as they were highly recommended. Their soybean milk and crispy dough paired beautifully with the tofu pudding. While some of the servers had limited English proficiency, they remained very friendly and attentive.

Clean, friendly service and overall decent meal.

Not sure I'd say this was a homerun meal for me as I'd hoped based on all the reviews & Google rating but it was good.  I ordered the spicy wonton with peanut sauce, spring rolls and stir fried chicken udon noodle.

I think all of it just needed more flavor for me to enjoy it more.

Service was wonderful, everyone was very attentive & friendly. Restaurant was clean (including restrooms) and it was packed when I visited. Next time I stop by I am going to definitely have to try the soup dumplings.

7/10

A decent soup dumpling place. I liked their appetizer options and the stir-fried noodles. Braised beef noodle soup is so so at best. Soup base is plain, while the noodles are factory made and basic at best.
Itâ€™s nice to see they also offer Asian breakfast items like soybean milk and crispy dough.

A truly enjoyable breakfast with soup dumplings and soy milks. We like both pork and crab and truffle pork options though the crab makes it much better. Shredded ginger and vinegar are must have pairings so donâ€™t sleep on them either.
The food is delicious and authentic! The soup dumplings were especially good. It was packed even at 9pm and eating in felt rather rushed. Fair price point!

I like the casual-ness of this place. Itâ€™s Michelin- recommended, yet low-key ï¼ˆin the morning when we went, at least) but still somewhat polished environment. At 10am on Saturday morning, no line and good amount of empty tables.

The ç”Ÿç…åŒ…/pan-fried pork buns were ok, I really like the taste of the dough. The meat itself was ok, it was slightly firm, and slightly sweet. There was juice sitting in a pool in the bun itself, but I felt like the meat itself was not that juicy.

The standard å°ç¬¼åŒ…/xiaolongbao was good; it had good flavor, but I wish the meat was more fragrant and more tender. I think the meat here was more juicier than the panfried buns, but still not fatty and melt in your mouth like some other ones that Iâ€™ve had.

We also got the å’¸è±†è…è„‘/savory tofu pudding, and I felt like it was bland. I wish there was more æ¦¨èœ/pickled vegetables in it, but at least there was chili oil and soy sauce/vinegar on the table to customize to your liking.

All in all, pretty good, but maybe not mind-blowing for someone traveling a long-distance specifically for this. But if I lived nearby, Iâ€™d probably come for breakfast/lunch often, due to it being a cozy spot.

Food - Amazing and fresh. Recommend the three treasures soup dumplings and pan fried pork buns. The red bean puff isnâ€™t sweet which is great. Would not recommend the scallion pancake as itâ€™s fried and pretty greasy.

Service- Excellent and swift through ordering via the paper and pencil.

Atmosphere - Very pleasant and pretty. When you enter thereâ€™s a mini running waterfall to the left.

For me, this place is a bit overrated. There are so many other dim sum and dumpling restaurants in the area that are so much better.

The service here is mediocre. They don't wait for you when you're ordering. They walk away as you are still placing your order and telling them what you don't want in the meal, etc. They get so busy that they neglect your tables and others that you have to flag them down.

The soups are okay. The only thing that is good is the dry noodle with beef.

I only come here when my crew wants dinner. I enjoy their company, and they like it here.

Amazing experience from the minute we walked in.

There was a waiting list and three parties ahead of us.
We were seated in less than 5 minutes.
You can tell the servers care about your experience with the welcoming and friendly environment, along with quick and consistent service.
Only downfall is the Melon Green Tea was too sweet and all soup dumplings besides (black truffle and pork and green gourd luffa, shrimp and pork) taste the same.
Food is served hot and quickly compared to other places Iâ€™ve visited.

Overall, this is an amazing place and I highly recommend.
chicken and pork soup and regular dumplings tasted great, the dow was soft and portion size was great. price is good as well. wish we had a spot like that in north ATL

Nan Xiang Soup Dumplings was fantastic. The appetizers were fresh and flavorful, and the dumplings were some of the best Iâ€™ve ever had. They were perfectly steamed with rich, fillings and a delicious broth inside. Everything came out very well made. This place is a must-visit for anyone who loves. high quality dumplings.
